result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valentin Uballe Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Valentin Uballe Jr. in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by the defendant that he does not qualify for SPD, but has paperwork for court appointed attorney. Court goes over form and based upon income, denies the request for court appointed attorney. Court sets out about 30 days for defendant to get attorney. Matter set before assigned judge - Johnson. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

Defendant Valentin Uballe Jr. in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Has been in touch with SPD - needs to follow up. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Timelines
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.N.H. dob 10/10/1985. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 1:22 PM. Defendant Valentin Uballe Jr in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes only. Discussion as to bond. Signature bond set for $5000. No contact with victim. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
